thread.title: Walsall trio face race to be involved at Barnsley
thread.title_full: Walsall trio face race to be involved at Barnsley

title: Walsall trio face race to be involved at Barnsley
text:
Tweet 
Goalkeeper Neil Etheridge, defender Andy Taylor and midfielder Sam Mantom all picked up knocks in Saturday’s 2-1 home loss to Chesterfield. 
Mantom is the biggest concern with the 23-year-old, who missed large parts of last season with a knee injury, being stretchered off. 
Taylor was also withdrawn in the second half with a knee injury while Etheridge required stitches on his knee after a collision with Sylvan Ebanks-Blake. 
“We had to rejig quite a bit against Chesterfield and now we’ll have to see what the injury list is like for Barnsley,” Smith said. 
“Sam has got a high ankle sprain. We don’t know how long he will be out for. Taylor has limped off feeling his knee. Neil is going to have to have stitches. But it’s the first time we have had to deal with that this season. What do you think?
